name: Camotes al Horno (Baked Yams)
author: Alenita
summary: A traditional dish from Puebla, Mexico, Camotes al Horno has the sweet simplicity of baked yams with butter, honey and sugar. Serve as a sweet treat on their own, or try them in combination with savory meat dishes for an interesting mix of flavors.
directions: Preheat oven to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C)
Place yams in a large pot of lightly salted, boiling water and cook for about 10 minutes, or until tender
Arrange the yams in a lightly greased 9x13 inch baking dish
Cut a slit down the middle of each one and dab 1 tablespoon of butter in each
Bake in the preheated oven for 5 to 10 minutes, or until golden
Spoon 1 teaspoon honey into each yam, sprinkle each with sugar and serve
